issue.title: Globals can no longer be tuples of strings

content.raw:
This can be fixed in Python 2 by telling eval() to not inherit the __future__ imports from the surrounding scope (pull request #20). 

For Python 3, strings will be unicode regardless, so that doesn't fix the problem. [pull request](https://github.com/h5py/h5py/pull/1031) submitted to h5py for this case. If they release a version with the fix then we can depend on that version to consider runmanager fully Python 3 compatible. Even if they don't accept my pull request I expect this will be supported in the future as more science applications move to Python 3. Either h5py will support it in some way or numpy will introduce a UTF8 encoded string array datatype, which would make it much easier.
